event.title: was founded by the Zaporozhian Cossacks under Anton Golovaty on August 25, 1792

data.event: The modern stanitsa was founded by the Zaporozhian Cossacks under Anton Golovaty on August 25, 1792 as the latter's residence and the first garrison of the Black Sea Cossack Host.
Until 1849, Taman was officially considered to be a town, even though it had no local government of its own and was governed from the nearby stanitsa of Akhtanizovskaya.
In 1849, Taman was re-organized as a stanitsa and established local government of its own.

event.title: August 2008, then-Prime Minister Vladimir Putin signed

data.event: In August 2008, then-Prime Minister Vladimir Putin signed a government resolution authorizing the development of a major international cargo port several kilometers south of Taman.
